Class Stormtrooper

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • Stormtrooper
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Stormleft, Stormright
    public class Stormtrooper
extends greenfoot.Actor
    The Stormtrooper class represents the famous Star Wars Empire soldiers in a game that can walk, shoot, take damage, and die. The Stormtrooper is designed to be used in two different game modes: In mode 1 - BossBattle -, the Stormtrooper can only respawn a certain number of times before being removed from the world permanently. In mode 2 - Endless -, the Stormtrooper can respawn an unlimited number of times. *
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Felipe Bertoli Oliveira

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stormtrooper

        public Stormtrooper​(int gameMode)
        Constructor for the Stormtrooper class. Iniatiate the shotDelay to Stormtrooper shoots in random times
        Parameters:
        gameMode - The game mode to be played (1 or 2).

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act()
        Act method for the Stormtrooper class. If the Stormtrooper is not dead, it calls the walk() method. If the Stormtrooper is dead, it decrements the deadTime variable and calls the respawn() method if the deadTime has reached 0.
        Overrides:
        act in class greenfoot.Actor

      • getSpawn

        public int getSpawn()
        Getter method for the deathCount attribute.
        Returns:
        The number of times the Stormtrooper has died.

      • walk

        public void walk()
        Method for the Stormtrooper to walk in a certain direction. The rest of the code is overwrited by this class's sons (Stormleft and Stormright).

      • fire

        public void fire()
        Fires a shot if the shot delay counter has expired. Uses a random number generator to determine if a shot should be fired. Creates a new Shoot object with the specified fire direction and adds it to the world. Sets the shot delay counter to the shot delay. Removes the shot object from the world if the actor is dead.

      • takeDamage

        public void takeDamage​(int damage)
        Reduces the actor's life by the specified damage amount and sets the image to the damaged state. Sets the damage time to 10. Calls the die() method if the actor's life is less than or equal to 0.
        Parameters:
        damage - the amount of damage to take

      • die

        public void die()
        Sets the actor's isDead flag to true, increments the deathCount by 1, and sets the location to (-100,-100). Sets the image's transparency to 0. Sets the deadTime to 500 if the gameMode is 1 and 150 if the gameMode is 2.

      • respawn

        public void respawn()
        Resets the actor's life to 30, sets the isDead flag to false, sets the location to (position, 493), adds the actor to the world at the specified position and sets the image to the walk image. Sets the image's transparency to 255 and the damaged image's transparency to 255.

      • respawnQuantity

        public void respawnQuantity​(int quantity)
        Recursively respawns the Stormtrooper a specified number of times.
        Parameters:
        quantity - The number of times the Stormtrooper will be respawned.
